intro: Galeobdolon montanum, commonly known as the mountain larkspur, is a herbaceous perennial native to the mountainous regions of North America. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae and is characterized by its tall, sparsely branched stems and clusters of blue to purple flowers. The plant has palmate leaves with five to seven leaflets, and its flowers are typically borne in racemes. It is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats, growing in well-drained soils at high elevations. Due to its toxicity, it is important to handle the plant with care.
